waist.title: Waist Circumference
steps: Stand straight with your back upright
Place the tape measure around your middle, just above your hipbones
Ensure the tape is horizontal around your waist
Take the measurement after exhaling naturally

neck.title: Neck Circumference
steps: Stand upright comfortably
Place the tape measure around the middle of your neck
Keep the tape horizontal
Leave room for one finger between the tape and your neck

hips.title: Hip Circumference
steps: Stand with feet slightly apart
Place tape around the widest part of your hips/buttocks
Ensure the tape is level all the way around
Measure without squeezing your hip muscles

skinfold.title: Skinfold Measurement
steps: Use a skinfold caliper
Pinch the skinfold between thumb and forefinger
Place caliper jaws 1cm from fingers
Wait 2 seconds and read the measurement
Repeat 3 times and take the average

general.title: Body Measurement
steps: Use a non-stretchable measuring tape
Stand in a straight, comfortable position
Ensure the tape is level and parallel to the floor
Read the measurement accurately in cm

bmr.title: Basal Metabolic Rate (BMR)
bmr.summary: The number of calories your body burns to perform basic life-sustaining functions while at rest.
details: BMR represents the minimum energy required for vital functions like breathing, circulation, and temperature regulation.
BMR is affected by age, gender, weight, height, and body composition.
People with more muscle mass have a higher BMR because muscle burns more calories than fat even at rest.

tdee.title: Total Daily Energy Expenditure (TDEE)
tdee.summary: The total number of calories you burn in a day, including physical activity.
details: TDEE accounts for all calories burned throughout the day, including daily activities and exercise.
It is calculated by multiplying your BMR by an activity factor.
The more active you are, the higher your activity factor, and thus your TDEE.

body_fat.title: Body Fat Percentage
body_fat.summary: The percentage of total body weight that is fat mass. It's a more accurate health indicator than BMI.
details: Essential fat ranges differ between men and women; women need more fat for hormonal function.

general.title: General Information
general.summary: General educational information about health and fitness.
details: Balancing diet and physical activity is key to maintaining good health.
Nutritional needs vary from person to person based on individual factors.
Consult a health professional before making major changes to your diet or exercise routine.
